question: 7 (b)
statement_raw:
Consider the MATLAB/Octave computation

 1> A=[0 2 1; 1 0 0; 0 1 0]
 A = 
    0  2  1
    1  0  0
    0  1  0

 2> [S D]=eig(A)
 S =
    0.80902  -0.57735   0.30902
    0.50000   0.57735  -0.50000
    0.30902  -0.57735   0.80902
 D =
 Diagonal Matrix
    1.61803         0         0
          0  -1.00000         0
          0         0  -0.61803

'''(b)''' If you picked initial values at random, what would you expect the large ''n'' behaviour of the resulting sequence to be? Give a reason.
